summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 between US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing updates on the Jeffrey Epstein probate case. It covers the Virgin Islands Attorney General's intervention, demands for a victim compensation program, and litigation planning. It references news articles about disputes between Epstein's estate executors and the Virgin Islands AG.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Organizes a Webex meeting to discuss planning litigation with Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.role: Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands
persons.context: Brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleged his lawyers were part of his fraud, placed liens on estate assets, and made specific demands for a victim compensation program.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor of Epstein's estate
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have potentially been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor of Epstein's estate
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have potentially been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Claimed that liens by the Virgin Islands AG have prevented the release of money from Epstein's estate for a victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Reported to have been asked to oversee a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers, having previously overseen major compensation funds.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of a Guardian article about the dispute between Epstein's estate and the Virgin Islands Attorney General.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased subject of the probate case, whose estate is the focus of litigation and victim compensation discussions.

connections.description: Both named as executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will and are jointly alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have potentially facilitated his fraud.
Indyke served as Epstein's lawyer and was named an executor of his estate.
Kahn served as Epstein's lawyer and was named an executor of his estate.
Moskowitz is the lawyer representing Epstein's estate, of which Indyke is an executor.
Moskowitz is the lawyer representing Epstein's estate, of which Kahn is an executor.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, has brought charges against the estate and alleged Indyke's potential complicity in Epstein's fraud.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, has brought charges against the estate and alleged Kahn's potential complicity in Epstein's fraud.

events.title: Probate Court Denies VI AG Intervention
events.description: The probate court denied the Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the Epstein probate proceedings.

events.title: Guardian Article on Estate Dispute
events.description: The Guardian publishes an article detailing the dispute between Epstein's estate executors and the Virgin Islands Attorney General over victim compensation and fraud allegations.

events.title: VI AG Brings Charges Against Estate
events.description: Virgin Islands Attorney General Denise George brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged his lawyers, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud. She also placed claims on Epstein's two islands.

events.title: Estate Proposes Feinberg Compensation Program
events.description: Epstein's estate asked courts to allow a voluntary victim compensation program overseen by Ken Feinberg.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell.

events.title: Epstein's Federal Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to a Florida state prostitution charge and served a 13-month jail sentence.

locations: Epstein's two islands (in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has placed liens on Epstein's estate assets, freezing bank accounts and demanding prior approval for all expenditures.
George alleges that Epstein's estate executors and lawyers, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

Key demands from the Virgin Islands AG for a victim compensation program include waiving NDAs for former employees, prohibiting third-party releases, and providing a complete inventory of all assets linked to Epstein.
Epstein's estate executors have requested emergency relief from the probate court to access estate funds without the AG's prior approval to pay expenses.
A dispute exists over the proposed victim compensation fund, with the estate supporting it and the Virgin Islands AG opposing the current proposal as lacking fairness and accountability.
